publicationStmt.p: This document contains the text of the Vilna edition of the Mishnah, slightly normalized and all punctuation removed, as the basis for the alignment of the witnesses to the text of the Mishnah. The text below uses the unvocalized text at , corrected to reflect the text of Yakhin u-Boaz. Changes are introduced as necessary to account for varying textual traditions to allow for proper pointing from the witness files to ref.xml

tagsDecl.rendition: Text padding extends into lines below displacing text. Use CSS to render
Text is ornamented in some way

refsDecl.p: The following describes the structure of the Mishnah, to be referenced by xml:id. The Mishnah is divided into six orders, each divided into tractates, each of which is further divided into chapters and mishnayot (mishnahs). Full references to an individual section uses the following system: ref.order.tractate.chapter.mishnah. Order and tractate refs are numerical and follow the outline below. By convention, references to chapter and mishnah are numerical. When looking up a specific witness, "ref." is replaced by the relevant /TEI/teiHeader/fileDesc/sourceDesc/listWit/witness@xml:id

div.note: Periodization is approximate. The coarsest subdivisions are into "Early," "Yavnean," "Ushan," and "Late" periods. Within these, both Albeck and Stemberger-Strack subdivide the generations further (Stemberger-Strack largely corresponding to Albeck). However, since Stemberger-Strack's index cites the generations according to the coarser periodization as T, T1, T2, etc., it is this periodization that is given in references to Stemberger-Strack.

list.head: Ushan
